channel.title: I want to pk
channel.description:
I want to start playing osrs but I am lazy and don't want to train. Does anyone know legit sites you can buy accounts off of? If there's too high of a risk of people recovering then obviously I won't.
I either want a great pure or a great main. My budget is very large and can get this done. Do you guys think if I buy off someone with tons of posts on sythe and I get the email set to it, I'll be safe?

item.title: I want to pk
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:8, topic:548747”]If you are p2p you can bot; however, there is some sort of 6 hour kick limit. I don’t know the specific stipulations of it (not being in combat, not dealing damage, not having walked, etc.); however, you can safely bot with p2p as long as you don’t suicide bot and you check the bot every 3-4 hours. A few 8 hour sessions probably won’t hurt.[/quote]That’s awesome. I just got back into it, and I noticed like 80% of people bot. Jagex is reviewing them individually and banning basically all goldfarmers and suicide bots.

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:9, topic:548747”]Err, this isn’t the case for me. Before I recovered my first account I was perm banned twice on my p2p accounts, on my recovered account (also p2p) I botted when I first started and got a 2 day ban…[/quote]They’ve changed the ruling a bit since. Not the official rules, but I think he’s right. My “gatherer” bot got banned but my account I actually play/check didn’t get banned.

Read full topic

item.title: I want to pk
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Vain_:

i know this. but they havent done anything in regards to guthan bandits either so i dont see why theyd deal with botters?

The poll also asked about that and it was voted the same

reyx7:

If you are p2p you can bot; however, there is some sort of 6 hour kick limit. I don’t know the specific stipulations of it (not being in combat, not dealing damage, not having walked, etc.); however, you can safely bot with p2p as long as you don’t suicide bot and you check the bot every 3-4 hours. A few 8 hour sessions probably won’t hurt.

Err, this isn’t the case for me. Before I recovered my first account I was perm banned twice on my p2p accounts, on my recovered account (also p2p) I botted when I first started and got a 2 day ban…

Read full topic

item.title: I want to pk
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

If you are p2p you can bot; however, there is some sort of 6 hour kick limit. I don’t know the specific stipulations of it (not being in combat, not dealing damage, not having walked, etc.); however, you can safely bot with p2p as long as you don’t suicide bot and you check the bot every 3-4 hours. A few 8 hour sessions probably won’t hurt.

Read full topic

item.title: I want to pk
item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

^ there was a poll ran like a month or so ago in regards to what they should do with people splashing and stuff. the poll was ran and the majority vote stated that it didn’t need to be dealt with.

Read full topic

item.title: I want to pk
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:3, topic:548747”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=667655.msg4465098#msg4465098 date=1419574257]
any account can be recovered, no matter what. your best bet is to find someone you can trust personally, or just train tbh…

it doesnt take long to train honestly. especially since jagex doesnt ban “afk” training now.
[/quote]So do bots not get banned as long as you at least attempt to move around?[/quote]i honestly don’t get it. most bots are easily detected but they won’t ban afk magic splashing/guthan bandits.

Read full topic

item.title: I want to pk
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:2, topic:548747”]any account can be recovered, no matter what. your best bet is to find someone you can trust personally, or just train tbh…

it doesnt take long to train honestly. especially since jagex doesnt ban “afk” training now.[/quote]

I don’t have enough time to really get into it like that with all the questing and such. I wish I might still try a really trusted person on sythe, but I don’t use that site at all so I doubt anyone would trust me.

Read full topic
